title: 111_s971
content: This Act, known as "Jason's Law," focuses on truck parking facilities. The Secretary of Transportation will implement a pilot program to address the shortage of long-term parking for commercial motor vehicles on the National Highway System. Funds will be allocated to States, metropolitan planning organizations, and local governments based on applications submitted to the Secretary. Eligible projects will be determined for funding. Funds allocated under this subsection shall be used for projects serving the National Highway System, including construction of safety rest areas with parking for commercial vehicles and commercial motor vehicle parking facilities. The funds allocated for projects serving the National Highway System include construction of safety rest areas and commercial motor vehicle parking facilities, as well as promoting the availability of parking through intelligent transportation systems. Turnouts along the National Highway System are also being constructed. The Secretary prioritizes applicants for funds to improve commercial motor vehicle parking facilities and interchanges on the National Highway System. The Secretary prioritizes applicants for funds to improve commercial motor vehicle parking facilities based on severe shortages, consultations with stakeholders, and positive project impacts on safety, congestion, and air quality. A report to Congress on the pilot program results is due within 3 years of the Act's enactment. Funding authorization is provided. Funding of $20,000,000 annually from the Highway Trust Fund is authorized for fiscal years 2010 through 2015 for projects under this section. The funds are not transferable and remain available until expended, with the Federal share of project costs determined according to specific guidelines. Projects funded under this section are treated as projects on a Federal-aid system under title 23, United States Code.
